 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Baby in the Band
1.plot: Trisha throws a baby shower for her tour manager. On the menu; a hearty country quiche; cheese straws; and brownies.

2.title: Girlfriends
2.plot: Trisha's girlfriends visits. Fried chicken with gravy, slow-cooker mac and cheese, and pecan pie are prepared.

3.title: Grandma Knows Best
3.plot: Trisha prepares her grandmother's recipes, including chicken and dumplings; deviled eggs; coconut cake with coconut-lemon glaze.

4.title: Family Reunion
4.plot: Barbecue chicken is made, along with grilled Vidalia onions wrapped in bacon and key-lime cake.

5.title: Gwen's Girls
5.plot: Chicken-less pot pie and Georgia pate (aka redneck hummus) are made.

6.title: Daddy's Famous Stew
6.plot: Trisha shares her father's recipe for Brunswick stew. Also: drop biscuits; sweet and saltines.

1.title: A Wedding Shower to Remember
1.plot: Recipes for a bridal shower, including sugared pecans; mini-sandwiches made with chicken-poppy-seed salad; and strawberry cupcakes. Also: Trisha serenades the couple of honor.

2.title: Trisha's Tricks and Treats
2.plot: Trisha celebrates Halloween with her family. Recipes include candied apples; chicken-tortilla soup; and pumpkin roll.

3.title: Trisha's College Roommate Reunion
3.plot: Food that reminds Trisha of her college days is prepared with help from an old roommate. Recipes include biscuits with chocolate gravy; baby Lima beans; chicken pie; and lemon-meringue pie.

4.title: A Yearwood Thanksgiving
4.plot: Yearwood reveals the her traditional Thanksgiving menu: No Baste, No Bother Roasted Turkey with a Cranberry-Orange, Grandma Lizzie's Cornbread Dressing, and Sweet Potato Souffle.

5.title: Special Occasion Dinner
5.plot: A special dinner is prepared for a friend who wants to impress her chef husband. Recipes include baked ham with brown-sugar glaze; asparagus bundles; strawberry salad; and an almond skillet dessert.

6.title: Garth Brooks Is in the Kitchen
6.plot: Trisha shares recipes, that she loves to cook, with her husband Garth Brooks, who joins her in the kitchen. Included: black-bean lasagna; Thai salad; peanut-butter balls; and lemonade.

7.title: Holiday Cookie Party!
7.plot: Trisha is joined in the kitchen by her friend and her daughters for an annual holiday cookie swap. They make Sweet Tea, Snickerdoodles, Bess London's Pecan Tassies, and lovely Iced Sugar Cookies.

8.title: The Yearwood Sunday Supper
8.plot: Trisha recreates the Sunday supper of her childhood. The menu includes roast beef with gravy, green beans, spoon rolls and cocoa cake.

9.title: Trisha's Favorite Foods to Gift
9.plot: Trisha makes gifts out of food. Included: corn dip; raisin bread in a can; a Crock-Pot recipe for chocolate candy; and peanut brittle.

10.title: Brunch with Aunt T
10.plot: Trisha shows her niece how to make a Southern brunch, including blueberry pancakes; and apple dumplings. Also: Garth Brooks' breakfast-bowl recipe.

12.title: Counting Calories Southern Style
12.plot: Trisha shows her trainer how to make healthful Southern-style recipes. Included: chicken coated in cornflakes; veggie soup; Greek salad; and apple ambrosia.

13.title: Football, Friends and Comfort Food
13.plot: Food is prepared for a day of watching football with girlfriends. Included: sausage hors d'oeuvres; corn chips and cheese dip; chili served with sour cream corn bread; and green punch.

14.title: Family Fish Fry
14.plot: Trisha holds a fish fry in her backyard. On the menu: catfish with a side of cornmeal hush puppies; home-style French fries; and coleslaw. Also: dessert is peach cobbler with whipped cream.

1.title: Karri-Oke
1.plot: Trisha and her friend prepare dinner. The menu includes marinated steak; twice-baked potatoes; tossed salad with raspberry vinaigrette; and zucchini sauté.

2.title: Graduation Picnic
2.plot: A graduation celebration features broccoli salad; pimento cheese spread; cheese-stuffed burgers; and cold-oven pound cake with fruit compote.

3.title: Staycation
3.plot: Trisha prepares a menu featuring international flavors, including avocado salsa, pad Thai, Hawaiian fruit salad and an Old Yeller drink recipe.

4.title: Guy Food
4.plot: Some "manly" recipes are prepared, including pulled-pork sandwiches, baked-bean casserole, and sweet potato salad. Also: Samoa s'mores are eaten around a campfire.

5.title: Z-Girls
5.plot: Trisha treats her workout pals to a Latin feast that includes salsa ranchera, a chicken-tortilla casserole, cheater beans and frozen sangaritas.

6.title: Poker Night
6.plot: Trisha hosts a ladies' poker night and serves finger-friendly party food, which includes meatballs; cheese boats; spicy edamame hummus; and what she calls a Lipstick Mandarin cocktail.

7.title: Movie Night
7.plot: Trisha prepares a feast inspired by the movie, Steel Magnolias (1989), including jalapeño poppers; low-country boil; and red velvet cake with gray cream-cheese frosting.

8.title: Weeknight Suppers
8.plot: A menu for a busy weeknight. Included: pork chops and rice; green beans and tomatoes; lemon squares.

9.title: All About Me
9.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, make some of Trisha's favorites, including easy Thousand Island dressing, creamed beef on toast and old-fashioned strawberry shortcake.

10.title: Family Recipes
10.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, reminisce about childhood food memories and cook favorite family recipes, including Gwen's potato-beef casserole; collard greens; and iced Italian cream cake.

11.title: Rainy Day Food
11.plot: Trisha and a friend make slow-cooked comfort foods, including chicken-and-rice soup, meatloaf and, for dessert, sour-cream-and-coffee cake.

12.title: Breakfast for Supper
12.plot: A casserole made with breakfast sausage is prepared, along with one prepared with hash browns. Also: pecan-pie muffins; and a grapefruit-pineapple Bellini.

13.title: Class Reunion
13.plot: Trisha gets together with her college roommates and makes a marinated-vegetable salad, chicken piccata and brownie-batter cookies, plus a "tickled punch",

1.title: Retro TV Dinners
1.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, get into the spirit of the 1950s, as they prepare a retro TV dinner. Included: individual chicken potpies; green beans with cheese sauce; and frosted cupcakes filled with chocolate pudding.

2.title: No Fuss Thanksgiving
2.plot: Trisha plans a stress-free Thanksgiving with close friends. Her quick-and-easy menu includes turkey-and-dressing casserole; homemade gravy; buttery roasted carrots; and sweet potato pie.

3.title: Kelly Clarkson in the Kitchen
3.plot: Kelly Clarkson stops by Trisha's house for a home-cooked meal. Recipes include corn salsa; stuffed pork chops; a sweet-and-crunchy garden salad; Kelly's favorite no-baked squares, made w/ chocolate, pretzels and peanut butter.

4.title: Redneck Cocktail Party
4.plot: A Sex and the City (1998) viewing party featuring a menu of Southern finger foods, including chicken bites; cream cheese roll-ups; and teacakes. Also: "summer-in-a-cup" served in a martini glass.

5.title: Easy Holiday Brunch
5.plot: Trisha throws a brunch to celebrate the holidays with her band. On the menu is roast beef, a cheesy asparagus casserole, cherry mini muffins and a gingerbread cocktail.

6.title: Party Food
6.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, throw themselves a joint birthday party at a bowling alley. They create a stress-free and fun menu featuring a ranch-dressing cheese log; mini-chicken pizzas; and chocolate cake with divinity frosting.

7.title: Healthy Twists
7.plot: Healthy twists on Southern classics are presented when Trisha spends time in the kitchen with chef Art Smith. On the menu: slimmed-down carrot cake; un-fried chicken; garlic-cauliflower mash.

8.title: Straight Up Comfort Food
8.plot: A menu of comfort food is prepared, with help from Wendy Williams. The menu includes ribbon meatloaf; creamed-style corn; decadent banana pudding; and a cherry-ginger julep.

9.title: Make-Ahead Meals
9.plot: A hip-hop dance class is followed by a make-ahead meal, featuring a baked spaghetti pie, spinach salad with garlic dressing and a cheesecake with fresh strawberry sauce.

10.title: Feeding the Home Team
10.plot: Trisha invites former NFL quarterback Kurt Warner and his family over, when she prepares recipes that are perfect for a hungry crowd. Included: BBQ pork ribs; easy baked beans; butterscotch-and-peanut-butter bars.

11.title: Indoor Camping
11.plot: A meal for nieces and nephews, who are camping inside Trisha's living room. On the menu: banana bread; saucy trout; Spanish rice and grilled zucchini.

12.title: Chocolate, Chocolate and More Chocolate
12.plot: Freezer-friendly chocolate desserts are on the menu, including fudge; pound cake; chocolate-chip-cookie-dough balls. Also: a hurricane cocktail made with the dark, sweet stuff.

13.title: Gold Medal Comfort
13.plot: Trisha cooks for Olympic gold-medal-winning gymnasts Nadia Comaneci and Bart Conner. On the menu: pork medallions; a garlic-grits casserole; and pineapple upside-down cake. Also: Nadia's salata de vinete is prepared.

1.title: Southern Basics with a Twist
1.plot: In the Season 5 premiere, Trisha adds her own fun twist to several classic Southern recipes, including making a BPT, which is a sandwich with bacon, jalapeño-pimento cheese and fried green tomatoes. Also: deviled eggs with sour cream and bacon; banana-pudding cake.

2.title: Barbecue with a Master
2.plot: Trisha cooks brisket, after getting a lesson in barbecue from John Cash, the owner of her favorite BBQ joint. She also makes unfried pickles with a ranch dressing; cooked-to-death green beans; and blackberry cobbler.

3.title: Updated Classics
3.plot: Trisha spends time with her nephew, cooking a lunch made up of sloppy joes, green salad with French dressing, and home-cooked fries. Their day, together, ends on a sweet note with a chocolate-peppermint milkshake.

4.title: Simple Weeknight Solutions
4.plot: Trisha shares some stress-free recipes, including lemon-citrus fish; herb-rice pilaf; and Mrs. Carter's skillet-apple pie.

5.title: Feeding Hungry Boys
5.plot: Trisha prepares a meal for her nephew and his college friends. On the menu: sausage and peppers; Garth's pasta salad; protein-packed power balls; and chewy chocolate-chip cookies.

6.title: Boxed Lunch
6.plot: Trisha makes Garth a boxed lunch, consisting of a turkey-meatloaf sandwich, Gwen's coleslaw, Mari's oatmeal cookies, and pineapple-flavored sweet tea.

7.title: All Things Miniature
7.plot: Bite-sized portions are prepared when Trisha and her girlfriend have a tea party. On the menu: creamy asparagus soup; mini egg-salad sandwiches; stuffed peppers; monkey-bread muffins.

8.title: Surprise Supper
8.plot: Trisha prepares a surprise dinner for her band, before a concert at a historic venue. On the menu: a beef-and-stout stew cooked in a slow cooker; a lettuce wedge served w/ blue-cheese dressing; and a Texas sheet cake with chocolate ganache.

9.title: Blue Plate Special
9.plot: Ree Drummond helps Trisha make classic diner food, as they bond over their Oklahoma roots. On the menu: chicken fried steak, spinach with bacon and onions; baked macaroni and cheese; and chocolate pie.

10.title: Homage to Julia Child
10.plot: Trisha pays tribute to Julia Child, by putting her own twist on classic French dishes, including beef bourguignon, potato pancakes, and apple charlotte.

11.title: A Romantic Dinner
11.plot: An anniversary dinner is prepared. On the menu: chicken saltimbocca; roasted vegetables with balsamic glaze; and chocolate-orange cake.

12.title: Big Family Thanksgiving
12.plot: Trisha prepares a Thanksgiving feast for her family, including a ranch-injected fried turkey; Brussels sprouts with pistachios; broccoli cornbread; and a lemon-pecan pie.

13.title: Just Because Party
13.plot: Trisha throws a "Just Because" party. The menu includes chicken-and-wild-rice casserole; zucchini cakes with herb sour cream; fresh apple pie; and a signature cocktail.

14.title: Christmas Eve Dinner
14.plot: A Christmas Eve dinner is prepared. On the menu: a honey-mustard glazed ham; grits-and-greens casserole; sautéed parsnips and carrots; and a snappy pear crumble for dessert.

15.title: Slim Down Secrets
15.plot: Healthy cooking is discussed when Trisha and her niece prepare a meal that includes raspberry chicken; a green salad w/Feta, garbanzo, walnuts, lemon juice and olive oil; edamame Parmesan; chocolate angel food cake w/macerated strawberries.

1.title: Weekend Breakfast
1.plot: In the Season 6 premiere, Trisha invites friends over for a special weekend breakfast, consisting of bacon waffles with maple syrup; an asparagus frittata; lemon-blueberry bread; and a cinnamon-cereal cocktail.

2.title: Comfort to the Max
2.plot: Comfort food is prepared. On the menu: cornbread salad with buttermilk-chive dressing; cowboy lasagna; chocolate chip cookies.

3.title: Knockout Dishes
3.plot: Penne with sausage sauce; garlic bread; orange and almond biscotti; knockout punch.

4.title: Mother's Day
4.plot: Trisha makes a Mother's Day meal for her sister, Beth Bernard. Included: maple-glazed salmon; potato casserole; roasted broccoli and carrots with carrot-top pesto; and apple-chocolate cake.

5.title: Feel-Good Food
5.plot: A hearty and healthy meal is prepared. On the menu: kale-and-chorizo soup; smashed sweet pea burgers with a side of cold cucumber salad; and baked apples for dessert.

6.title: Nashville Memories
6.plot: Trisha makes chicken-broccoli casserole and a French coconut pie to share with a songwriter friend. Also: a salad of mixed greens with roasted cherry tomatoes and fried goat cheese croûtons.

7.title: Family Grilling and Chilling
7.plot: Grilling recipes are demonstrated, when Trisha helps her family make pork candy, baked beans, corn on the cob still in its husk, and pineapple served with ice cream and a warm apricot sauce.

8.title: Record Release Party
8.plot: Trisha hosts a release party for a special limited-edition record. She prepares finger foods, including mini sausage-cheddar biscuits; chicken salad with fruit in lettuce cups; and vanilla cupcakes with peanut butter frosting.

9.title: Our Guys' Favorites!
9.plot: Father's Day is celebrated with a menu that includes biscuits and sausage gravy; taco pizza; and German chocolate cake with butterscotch frosting.

10.title: Glenda's Birthday Costume Party
10.plot: Trisha throws a costume party to celebrate a friend's birthday. On the menu: warm feta-artichoke dip; shrimp croquettes with green peas; and chocolate-chip-cheesecake bars.

11.title: Impromptu Get-Together
11.plot: Trisha's impromptu get-together with country singer Sunny Sweeney features a quick and easy summer menu of roasted-red-pepper hummus, cucumber bites, pulled chicken sandwiches with spicy slaw, and a refreshing grape salad.

1.title: Get Glam Awards Day
1.plot: Trisha eats light, in preparation for the ASCAP Awards show, in the Season 7 premiere. On the menu: a peanut-butter-and-banana breakfast smoothie; whipped sweet potatoes; chicken salad with homemade herbed crackers; avocado and cheese panini; and a chocolate cake in a mug.

2.title: Day Trip to Memphis
2.plot: A trip to Memphis with her friend Julie, to visit Graceland and other Elvis haunts, inspires Trisha and Julie to cook a banana-pancake sandwich filled with a spread made of peanut butter and maple syrup. Other recipes include: tamale-style pulled pork; and an indulgent vanilla milkshake with peanut-covered straws.

3.title: Working Late
3.plot: Trisha plans ahead for a busy week. Recipes include: spinach frittata; roasted beet salad and a black bean, feta and quinoa bowl; a slow-cooker beef brisket.

4.title: Camp Like a Girl
4.plot: A night of karaoke around the campfire includes a menu consisting of caprese skewers; quinoa-corn chowder with shrimp; grilled Andouille sausage and pepper pouches; tea-and-lemon punch; and the ultimate s'mores bar.

5.title: Game Day 101
5.plot: Trisha shows her nephew and his college pals how to make some dips perfect for a football-watching party. Varieties include black-eyed pea; caramelized onion; and pistachio cheese. Also: a manly riff on pigs in a blanket; a hearty cornbread chili casserole; quick chocolate chip cookies.

6.title: Biscuit Lovin'
6.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, eat at the Nashville restaurant, "Biscuit Love". Later, recipes inspired by their dining experience include hot chicken on Trisha's angel biscuit with their Mama's white gravy; biscuit waffles with lemon cream; an oatmeal biscuit with apple yogurt; and creamy grits with tomato gravy and greens.

7.title: Trisha's Birthday
7.plot: Garth Brooks grants Trisha's birthday wish, by cooking for his wife. On the menu: French toast for breakfast; chicken Alfredo served with a salad dressed with creamy feta; and double-stuffed brownies.

8.title: Country Music Hall of Fame
8.plot: Trisha gives Reba McEntire a tour of her exhibit at the Country Music Hall of Fame in Nashville. Afterwards, they cook a down-home dinner of bacon-wrapped turkey meatloaf; Brussels sprouts with dried cranberries and almonds; a sweet potato-and-leek casserole; and, for dessert, lemon pound cake with royal glaze.

9.title: All Things Cast Iron
9.plot: Trisha cooks hash browns with cheesy eggs and avocado in her cherished cast-iron pan, which she demonstrates how to care for, before making a recipe for country ham carbonara. For dessert, there's buttermilk-strawberry skillet cake with whipped cream and sugared pecans.

10.title: Barbie
10.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth Bernard, make a barbecue or "Barbie Q" feast, complete with chicken sliders with sweet and spicy Quickles, a quick coleslaw, smashed potato salad, and mini key lime cheesecakes.

11.title: Recipe Swap
11.plot: Chef Chloe Coscarelli helps Trisha prepare recipes for healthier eating. Included: avocado-pesto toast with a lightened-up tomato bisque; black-eyed pea stew; quick biscuits with maple butter; lemon olive oil cupcakes with coconut whipped cream.

12.title: Habitat Build
12.plot: Trisha feeds Habitat for Humanity volunteers from a food truck. On the menu: ham and pimento cheese biscuit sandwiches; baked potato soup; taco-stuffed potato skins; and chocolate fudge chip cookies.

13.title: Road Food
13.plot: A tour stop in Milwaukee inspires Trisha to make a Midwestern butter burger with ale-infused cheese sauce; pretzel-crusted fried cheese with spicy ranch dipping sauce; a deep-dish pecan pie; and an old-fashioned cocktail.

1.title: Pizza and a Movie
1.plot: In the Season 8 premiere, Trisha Yearwood invites the guys over for pizza and a movie. On the menu: malted milk fudge; an Italian seven-layer dip; basil pesto pizza.

2.title: Let's Get It Percolating
2.plot: A java-inspired menu includes coffee coffee cake; coffee-rubbed fish tacos; and tiramisu affogato.

3.title: Fan Fare
3.plot: Trisha connects with her fans on social media while cooking lunch. Recipes include cinnamon orange rolls; a Bloody Mary; cheesy spicy bacon straws; and hummingbird pancakes.

4.title: Cooking and Singing with Kids
4.plot: Five young musicians from the Music City Youth Orchestra get to spend the day with Trisha Yearwood. Included: they perform the song, "XXX's and OOO's". Also: they eat chicken enchiladas; nacho salads in a jar; and cinnamon cookies.

5.title: Par-T-Que
5.plot: Trisha invites her girlfriends, Jenn and Sara, over for a day of barbecue, cocktails and games. The menu includes potato salad, barbecue pork ribs, a cherry Moscow mule, a butterscotch pie.

6.title: Quick-Nic
6.plot: Easy to make recipes for a stress-free picnic include orzo salad; watermelon salsa; apricot rosemary glazed chicken; zucchini bread; and a citrus cocktail.

7.title: Trisha's Day Off
7.plot: Trisha spends a day off, by cooking her weekend favorites and hanging out with her dog, Emmy. She demonstrates recipes for praline cheesecake bars; jambalaya and rice; a ginger grapefruit fizz; and a chocolate-covered snack called Pandora's box.

8.title: Tailgating
8.plot: Ballgame food. Recipes include "Go Dawgs!" Greens; baked chicken tenders; easy blueberry pie bars; and a hard cider cocktail. Also: Trisha throws out the first pitch and sings the National Anthem.

9.title: Chop Chop
9.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, pretend to be on a cooking competition TV show in their own kitchen; Trisha makes three courses using a mystery basket of ingredients. She comes up with dishes, including a white wine spritzer with watermelon and basil; wild rice and mushroom soup; beef and vegetable stir fry; and strawberry bread pudding with fruit sauce.

10.title: Masquerade and Cocktails
10.plot: Trisha throws an all-out New Orleans-themed party for her friends; the menu features Beigrets, mini-crab cakes, roast beef po'boys, and an Ode to NOLA cocktail; the party is complete with a brass band parade.

11.title: Giving Thanks
11.plot: Trisha and Beth deliver turkeys and donate food to the YWCA of Nashville, Tennessee; they cook a portable meal of sweet potato pudding, slow-cooker pulled turkey, buttermilk cornbread and cran-apple crisp for Trish's niece, Ashley, a nurse.

12.title: Sunday Funday
12.plot: Trisha Yearwood prepares for a fun-filled day with friends, by making Buffalo wing dip and chili mac; the group heads out on a party bike to enjoy prosciutto cocktails; the friends go bowling and end the day with marbled chocolate brownies.

13.title: Cookie Swap
13.plot: Trisha Yearwood's close friends, Kim and Lisa, join her for a day of baking and drinking; gingerbread cookies; caramel candy and chocolate pinwheel cookies; white knight cocktails; inventive and festive cookie swap ideas.

1.title: Trisha Goes to Boot Camp
1.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her friend Natalie head to boot camp and then whip up a low-calorie but high flavor menu; kale chips; lemony orzo chicken soup; chickpea salad sandwiches; angel food cake with grapefruit compote.

2.title: Trisha on Ice
2.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her friend, Glenda, prepare food in exchange for skating lessons from Nashville's hockey team, the Predators; glazed limoncello cookies; chicken spinach lasagna; prosciutto-wrapped breadsticks; shaved sweet tea ice.

3.title: Money Savers
3.plot: Trisha Yearwood shows her nephews some budget-friendly and belly-filling recipes; garlic popcorn; breakfast burritos; PBJ smoothies; Thai peanut butter ramen; peanut butter mug cake with chocolate icing.

4.title: Halftime Funtime
4.plot: Trisha Yearwood invites family and friends over for a halftime-themed party; pimento cheese queso; spicy artichoke dip; Nashville hot chicken meatball sliders; lime and orange wedge gelatin shots; end zone dance competition.

5.title: Chocolate Rules
5.plot: Trisha Yearwood visits Mackenzie Colt, owner of the famous Colts Chocolates, to get a tour of the factory; Boston cream pie; chocolate-covered cereal mix; café mocha; frozen chocolate mudslide.

6.title: Picture This!
6.plot: Trisha Yearwood invites over her tour photographer to snap some pictures, in exchange for a home-cooked lunch; cheeseburgers with garlic mayo; fried pickles and onion rings; a vanilla orange tart; sparkling cherry lime soda.

7.title: Shoebox Memories
7.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her sister, Beth Bernard, go through mom and dad's shoe box of recipes; company chicken; Mama's scalloped potatoes; wild scuppernong pie with cinnamon swirl ice cream.

8.title: Coffee Talk
8.plot: The gang hangs around, after filming Trisha's online streaming show, "Coffee Talk"; Mexican iced coffee; quick roasted chicken with garlicky herb sauce; cheesy hasselback potatoes; a ginger peach crumble with buttered pecan topping.

9.title: Eggs All Day
9.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her sister, Beth Bernard, learn the basics of egg farming; avocado toast with scrambled eggs; deviled egg salad club sandwiches; sweet potato asparagus hash with fried eggs; chocolate souffles with triple raspberry sauce.

10.title: Tour Favorites
10.plot: Trisha Yearwood creates a menu based on her experience in Portland, Oregon; filthy dirty martinis with blue cheese-stuffed olives; mashed potatoes; creamed spinach; cherry almond skillet shortbread; well-done steak; Trisha and Robert sing a duet.

11.title: Bringin' Home the Farm
11.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her sister, Beth Bernard, head out to a local farm and pick their own arugula; slow cooker pork loin; mushroom, asparagus and arugula risotto; strawberry buttermilk ice cream with homemade waffle cones.

12.title: Book and Wine Club
12.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her sister, Beth Bernard, prepare for their book club with a wine-inspired menu; Beth runs into best-selling author Ann Patchett; rotini with chicken marsala ragout; red wine chocolate cake; arugula salad with sparkling wine vinaigrette.

13.title: Trisha's Spicy Kitchen
13.plot: Trisha Yearwood and her friend Julie prepare spicy foods; spicy chipotle peanuts; South Tex-Mex rice; spicy turkey lettuce cups with red pepper jelly; blackberry black pepper cocktails.

1.title: Go Nuts for Doughnuts!
1.plot: A doughnut-based menu, including green onion cheddar doughnuts, doughnut grilled cheese, tortellini soup and an iced café bonbon.

2.title: Camp Trisha
2.plot: Notched up versions of campfire favorites, including filet mignon chili, grilled corn with jalapeno butter, s'mores fondue and campfire cocktails.

3.title: Hawaiian Cookout
3.plot: Trisha hosts a Hawaiian cookout for visiting friends, featuring dishes inspired by trips to Hawaii; rum-glazed shrimp skewers with mint chimichurri; crunchy slaw; mai tais and grilled dessert pizza.

4.title: Breakfast-Dinner Mash-Up
4.plot: Wildly inventive meals that fuse together breakfast and dinner ingredients; corn cakes and country ham scramble with red eye gravy; a flannel hash; sweet smoky hot sauce; a peaches and cream trifle with blueberry sauce.

5.title: Food, Fast!
5.plot: Danica Patrick helps Trisha in the kitchen; a cubano sandwich with quick pickles; pressure cooker potatoes with smoky aioli; three-bean salad with lemon Dijon vinaigrette; no-bake rocky road bars; Mojitos.

6.title: Seeing Double
6.plot: Trisha Yearwood celebrates her wax figure being inducted into Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum; pork tenderloin with bacon-onion jam; apple cider and sautéed apple basmati rice; warm wax bean salad with roasted tomatoes and sun-dried tomato dressing.

7.title: Trisha's Open House Tailgate
7.plot: Trisha brings the tailgate to her house to show that everyone can enjoy some tailgating fun; a giant hoagie; sweet tots; loaded pizza dip; dessert nachos; pro football player DeMarco Murray.

8.title: Trisha's Halloween Prep
8.plot: Trisha Yearwood invites her friend, Glenda, over to try some Halloween costume ideas and test some Halloween recipes; Jack-O'-Lantern stuffed peppers; roasted butternut squash hummus with spooky chips; caramel apples and a black light cocktail.

9.title: Trisha Goes Paintballing
9.plot: Trisha Yearwood spent the morning playing paintball and recounts the crazy battles and most memorable moments; garlic knots with an easy ranch dipping sauce; pasta pizza, cherry lime soda and a cola cake.

10.title: Trisha's Pottery Party
10.plot: Trisha whips up roasted cherry tomato, ricotta and basil crostini; angel hair pasta with chicken avocado pesto; grilled baby eggplant with balsamic glaze; painted white chocolate bark.

11.title: Trisha's Misfit Thanksgiving
11.plot: Trisha Yearwood hosts a misfit Thanksgiving for all her local friends; orange maple glazed turkey; rosemary shallot gravy; slow cooker acorn squash; roasted chestnut apple stuffing; champagne with pomegranate; spice cake with lemon sauce.

12.title: Concert with Friends
12.plot: Spicy black-eyed pea salad; jerk chicken with tropical chutney; spiced plantain chips with mint garlic sauce; a mango lime spritzer; Trisha later surprises her backup singers with backstage passes to meet John Legend.

13.title: Ugly Christmas Sweater
13.plot: Cranberry pecan baked brie; fruitcake cookies; holiday deviled eggs; pigs in a wreath and a festive punch; Glenda and her husband come over for a joyful rendition of Garth's song, "Ugly Christmas Sweater".

7.title: Shoebox Memories Vol. 2
7.plot: Trisha and her sister, Beth, reminisce about their favorite family comfort food; the menu includes Yearwood family classics such as buttermilk rolls, creamed spinach casserole, oven BBQ chicken and hundred dollar cupcakes with caramel icing;

-1.title: Episode dated 30 December 2017
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Trisha Yearwood will share food traditions and display her Southern hospitality, sharing recipes with friends and family and preparing Sunday dinners to planning family reunion barbecues. Each of the six themed episodes will invite viewers into Yearwood's kitchen for her favorite meals and family stories.
imdb.title: Trisha's Southern Kitchen
plot: 'Trisha Yearwood' (qv) will share food traditions and display her Southern hospitality, sharing recipes with friends and family and preparing Sunday dinners to planning family reunion barbecues. Each of the six themed episodes will invite viewers into Yearwood's kitchen for her favorite meals and family stories.::Food Network

'Trisha Yearwood' (qv)d is a renowned singer who has won a number of awards in her career, including multiple Grammys. But what people may not know about Yearwood is she is also an accomplished cook. This series invites viewers into the singer's kitchen as she showcases her family-inspired recipes and food traditions. While preparing her recipes, Yearwood shares nostalgic stories and is visited by family and friends. Whether she's preparing traditional dishes from her childhood or planning events like a baby shower or a family reunion, Yearwood prepares dishes that viewers can duplicate in their own kitchens.::Jwelch5742
